pgTitle: List of film festivals in North and Central America

rows.text: Speed filmmaking competition and festival. Entries accepted from anywhere in the world. Held annually in April.
Action On Film International Film Festival
Started as part of the World Martial Arts Trade Show and International Championships.
Entries accepted from anywhere in the world. Held annually in September.
Film festival showcasing experimental and independent film in North America. Held annually in late March.
An international festival held annually in November.
German-language film festival outside of Europe, held annually in Autumn.
Big Bear Lake International Film Festival
Committed to presenting emerging talents of independent filmmakers and screenwriters, held annually in September.
3 day festival held annually in the spring
Annually showcasing feature films, documentaries and shorts in September.
Annually showcasing short, medium length and feature length science fiction, fantasy, horror, action, thriller, animation, cult and fan films.
Held annually for 10 days in late September or early October.
Held Annually to celebrate Independent Films from World Cinema
Focuses on films with great messages. The festival is held in September at an open-air theater. Every entry will receive a film review.
Celebrates and promotes filmmakers with an emphasis on Michigan-made, homegrown talent. A four-day festival taking place in venues across Lansing.
Festival of films for kids & youth in North America. Held annually in late October for 10 days.
Cine Las Americas International Film Festival
Held annually in the spring showcasing Latin American, Latino and Indigenous films.
Debuts February 12–14, 2010. CEFF celebrates sex-positive, diverse and empowering erotic cinema and performance by amateurs, independent artists and the avant-garde.
The Cleveland International Film Festival is a 12 day event held annually in spring and includes Feature and Short Subject Films.
North American film festival, held annually in November. As a competition festival, it is also known as The Chris Awards.
The festival of unknowns (i.e. no celebrities)
DC Asian Pacific American Film Festival
Held annually in June, and hosts the annual DWIFF Challenge
Held Annually in December for Spanish and Latin Independent Films.
Documentary film festival held in Western Canada annually for ten days in May.
Annual 10-day festival in September featuring short films, documentaries, dramatic features, partys and an eclectic mix of filmmaker guests.
Expresión en Corto International Film Festival
Short horror film Festival travelling Western Canada, 10 Cities in 10 days.
Film North - Huntsville International Film Festival (HIFF)
Huntsville International Film Festival, for emerging Canadian and International Filmmakers to exhibit, promote, entertain and inform the audience.
Flatland Film Festival is part of the Louise Hopkins Underwood Center for the Arts since its inception.
The Festival includes narrative and documentary features and shorts, animation, midnight movies, and a full array of educational forums, glamorous parties, and other special events.

The Forum Film Festival features a mix of current blockbusters, classic favorites, documentaries, and independent movies. The Forum holds a Short Film Competition on a legal theme, which accepts submissions from around the globe. The Festival is held annually in October.
Gotham Screen Film Festival & Screenplay Contest
Showcase of new American and international cinema, with a competitive screenplay contest.
Held annually the festival is focused on showcasing independent films in the digital medium and to presenting the outstanding work of independent filmmakers
Mexico and Latin American film festival

Held annually in the fall for two weeks. HIFF states that it "is dedicated to the advancement of understanding and cultural exchange among the peoples of Asia, the Pacific and North America through the medium of film."
The Haydenfilms International Film Festival is a hybrid of traditional and online film festivals that awards a prize of $25,000.
The annual Heartland Film Festival introduces audiences to transformative independent films from around the world. Heartland awards more than $135,000 in prize money every year at the festival.

High Falls Film Festival celebrates the work of women filmmakers. It includes features, documentaries, shorts, children’s and young adult programs, programs in film education and student film making competitions.
Held annually in mid-October, its purpose is to recognize and honor filmmakers in East Central Minnesota and other American cities up and down Old US Highway 61.
Hot Docs Canadian International Documentary Festival
India International Film Festival (IIFF) of Tampa Bay
Held annually. Feature films, short films, and documentaries that are produced by Indians, films with Indian actors or actresses, or films with Indian themes.
Inside Out Toronto Lesbian and Gay Film and Video Festival
Canada’s largest queer film and video festival, held over 11 days in May
Exhibiting films by and/or featuring Black women from around the world in non-stereotypical roles.
Held annually in conjunction with the Des Moines Arts Festival.
Held annually for 4 days in mid-May.

Part of the KahBang music-art-film Festival, built on discovering the Best Emerging Filmmakers, Narrative and Documentary Features, Comedy Films, Short Films, Music Docs, and awarding one notable filmmaker with the "Kevin Norwood Bacon Award for Achievement in Cinema". Held Annually in August.
Held annually in the spring. Host of the L.A. Comedy Scripts screenplay competition.
Held annually in the beginning of June. This southern film festival features narrative film, documentary films, short film, panels, and unforgettable events
Held around Valentine's Day. The Festival screens only short films under 30 minutes in length.
Showcase for international documentaries in the United States. Held annually in November at the American Museum of Natural History in the New York City.

Held annually in March, but also includes summer and winter film series, and special events at other times of the year. Community-oriented, featuring action/activism-inspiring films. Filmmakers/film subjects regularly speak after screenings.
Held annually in early September. Festival is hosted by the Martha's Vineyard Film Society
Mexico City International Contemporary Film Festival
Short Film Festival held annually in mid November.
The Mile High Horror Film Festival is held annually each October. Its mission is to showcase the very best independent horror films from around the world.

Film writers, filmmakers and film score composers who, through their creative work, actively increase awareness, provide multiple viewpoints, address complex social issues, and strengthen ties between international audiences.
Annual film festival featuring the work of independent filmmakers.
Held annually in June. Dedicated to promoting cultural awareness and appreciation of the art of screenwriting in the world of cinema. Has both film and screenplay competitions.
Native American Film and Video Festival
Biannual festival held at the Smithsonian National Museum of the American Indian featuring indigenous works from across the Americas
National Film Festival for Talented Youth
Youth film festival, showcasing the work of filmmakers from around the globe (aged 22 or under)
Founded in 1999, the Newport Beach Film Festival has evolved into a multicultural event, attracting over 40,000 attendees to Orange County.
Founded in 2009, the Nevada Film Festival is held annually in the Las Vegas Valley in November.
New Jersey Independent South Asian Cine Fest

Dedicated to South Asian independent films. Features North American premieres and a select list of fresh and independent films by debut as well as established South Asian filmmakers or films on South Asian themes from all over the world
New York International Children's Film Festival
Film festival for kids in North America, held annually from late-February to mid-March.
New York City Independent Film Festival
A celebration of the true independent filmmaker, accepting narratives, documentaries, and music videos from anywhere in the world
New York City International Film Festival
A film festival dedicated to discovering new talent and creating distribution for independent filmmakers, held annually in June.
An international short film festival that takes place annually in Albany New York.

The Orlando Film Festival seeks to inspire student, future and current filmmakers in the art of filmmaking, and to enhance the movie viewing experience in Downtown Orlando through creative, unique and entertaining events. Held annually in October/November
Screenings include the Philadelphia Filmathon and the annual 21-Day Filmmaking Competition.
Also known as PhilaFilm, an international, Independent film and video competition.
Founded as the Philadelphia International Gay & Lesbian Film Festival, the name was changed to QFest in 2009. Presented by the Philadelphia Cinema Alliance.
An international festival held annually the third weekend in September.
Better known by its French name "Festival de Cinéma de la Ville de Québec (FCVQ)", it's dedicated to putting movies at the heart of Quebec City.
Located beneath the red mountains of Southern Utah this international festival is held annually each November.
International festival of short films in early May.
Film festival in the U.S. dedicated to films by and about people with disabilities. Founded in New York City and tours throughout the United States.
Held annually for 6 days during the second week of August
Held annually in early November showcasing films made by Women. The festival features a mix of documentary, short and narrative films.
Held in September the festival showcases international narrative features, short films, documentary, Native American and Music for Film.
San Luis Obispo International Film Festival
Hosts the Arizona premieres of many foreign, art, and independent films.
One of the largest film festivals in the United States.
An international film festival screening films from emerging and independent filmmakers from around the world.
Set in the heart of California wine country, one of the smaller "destination" film festivals in the United States.
Held annually in November at Theatre 80 St. Marks in the East Village of New York City, Take Two is a progressive festival that is part of the gallery and NY art collective Salon Ciel.
This four-day festival, held in October, accepts independent short and feature submissions from all over the world.
Only 40 films are admitted each year.
Recognizes original digital media productions created by student filmmakers, ages 7–18, and their teachers.
The festival's focus is to bring together talented filmmakers from diverse backgrounds.
A program of Pittsburgh Filmmakers, emphasizing independent film.
Film festival open to the general public, it is held annually in September.
Championing films that breathe new life into the nonfiction format, the festival features the finest new movies redefining the now-exploding form.
TCFF aims to show audiences the best films the industry has to offer while also showcasing the Twin Cities as a "hot spot for premiere work".
Held annually for two weeks in late September and early October.
Largest queer film festival in Western Canada. Held annually for eleven days in late August.
The Vaughan Film Festival is a special event showcasing international short films and art forms of all genres.
Environmental and human rights film festival
Annual independent film festival held in November
Monthly Feedback Film Festival; held at the National Film Board of Canada every month.
Annual showcase of independent and international documentary, narrative, experimental, student and animated films. Run for 4 days in early April
North American film festival, held annually.
Film festival exclusive to self-financed filmmakers.
